main event: A rancher in Llano, Texas spotted a copper-colored object with quarter moon-shaped lights on it on August 20, 1949 between 3:00 AM and 5:30 AM.
interesting points: The object was about 15 feet high and 3-4 feet wide, and contained around 11 quarter moon-shaped lights that were 6 inches in diameter.
The object rose straight up to an altitude of 250 feet in 15 minutes, and then moved south about 1500 feet over the course of 2 hours.
The object was bright enough to cast shadows and hurt the observer's eyes if looked at for too long.
The observer's radio had experienced unusually strong static and interference in the days leading up to the sighting.
The observer claimed the Milky Way, Big Dipper, and Little Dipper were out of their normal positions in the sky.
sighted object: copper-colored object with quarter moon-shaped lights
